Package hotelproject.controllers.utils

Class PasswordAuth

java.lang.Object
hotelproject.controllers.utils.PasswordAuth
public final class PasswordAuth
extends java.lang.Object
Hash passwords for storage, and test passwords against password tokens. Instances of this class can be used concurrently by multiple threads.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static int DEFAULT_COST
    The minimum recommended cost, used by default
    static java.lang.String ID
    Each token produced by this class uses this identifier as a prefix.

  • Constructor Details

    • PasswordAuth

      public PasswordAuth()

    • PasswordAuth

      public PasswordAuth​(int cost)
      Create a password manager with a specified cost
      Parameters:
      cost - the exponential computational cost of hashing a password, 0 to 30

  • Method Details

    • hash

      public java.lang.String hash​(char[] password)
      Hash a password for storage.
      Parameters:
      password - an array of characters.
      Returns:
      a secure authentication token to be stored for later authentication

    • authenticate

      public boolean authenticate​(char[] password, java.lang.String token)
      Authenticate with a password and a stored password token.
      Parameters:
      password - an array of characters.
      token - a string.
      Returns:
      true if the password and token match.

    • hash

      public java.lang.String hash​(java.lang.String password)
      Hash a password in an immutable String. Passwords should be stored in a char[] so that it can be filled with zeros after use instead of lingering on the heap and elsewhere.
      Parameters:
      password - a string to hash.
      Returns:
      the corresponding hash.

    • authenticate

      public boolean authenticate​(java.lang.String password, java.lang.String token)
      Authenticate with a password in an immutable String and a stored password token.
      Parameters:
      password - (a string)
      token - (a string)
      Returns:
      return true if a password corresponds to a token, else false.
      See Also:
      hash(String)
